that's a good question I mean I guess uh

interesting things about social
networking is that it is very different
from search in that there are obvious
and very explicit Network
externalities that uh you need to be on
a certain social network because all
your friends are there and to move from
that to another social network requires
either abandoning your friends or
convincing them to come with you it's
it's non-trivial as opposed to if I find
a better search engine I just switch my
browser default homepage and there I go
I'm I'm off I'm off to the races on the
new search engine um so I think that's
incredibly valuable from a business
perspective uh from a consumer
perspective it's something I would be
concerned about we all got locked into

people still are because of those same
kinds of and network externalities I
needed a Windows computer because all my
friends had a Windows computer and
that's a problem that's diminished over

friends so now I need an Apple computer
